description: APPLICATION FOR A LOFT CONVERSION WITH A FLAT ROOF REAR DORMER AND TWO FRONT ROOFLIGHTS IN THE FRONT ROOF SLOPE.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plansDrawing no: A 02 (Site Location Plan) Dated 13 May 2024 
Drawing no: A 01/LPA Rev 2 removed roof terrace (Proposed First Floor Plan) Dated 03 June 2024  
Drawing no: A 01/LPA Rev 2 removed roof terrace (Proposed Second Floor Plan) Dated 03 June 2024  
Drawing no: A 02/ LPA Rev 2 removed roof terrace (Proposed East Elevation Plan) Dated 03 June 2024    
Drawing no: A 01(Proposed West Elevation Plan) Dated 03 June 2024     
Drawing no: A 01 (Proposed Rear North Elevation Plan) Dated 03 June 2024 Drawing no: A 01(Proposed Front South Elevation Plan) Dated 03 June 2024  Drawing no: A 01/ LPA Rev 2 removed roof terrace (Proposed Roof Plan) Dated 03 June 2024       
Drawing no: A 01 (Proposed Section A-A' Plan) Dated 03 June 2024        

:

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - No Use of Flat Roof  - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
https://www.gov.uk/party-walls-building-works

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with advice to Amend the application by the Removal of the OPEN  ROOF TERRACE SPACE ON THE SECOND PLAN  ON THE  ADVICED OF THE CASE OFFICER .
   ii) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   iii) The application was approved without delay.
